questions.question_text: When working on a project, do you prefer:

options.text: Jumping right in and tackling tasks head-on to get quick results.
Carefully planning each step before you start, to ensure everything is organized.

questions.question_text: In group discussions, do you prefer:

options.text: Focusing on building connections with people and understanding their feelings.
Thinking about innovative ideas that can improve the groupâ€™s future goals.

questions.question_text: When faced with a decision, do you tend to:

options.text: Choose the most practical and efficient action that will deliver results quickly.
Consult with others to understand how the decision impacts everyone involved.

questions.question_text: In managing your work, do you:

options.text: Use structured plans and timelines to keep everything on track.
Adapt to new opportunities as they arise, even if it means changing the plan.

questions.question_text: When you think about success, is it more about:

options.text: Accomplishing tasks and seeing tangible results.
Seeing the big picture come to life with new and creative ideas.

questions.question_text: When working with a team, do you prefer to:

options.text: Lead by ensuring everyone has a well-defined role and responsibilities.
Inspire others with a shared vision and motivate them towards that goal.

questions.question_text: How do you usually approach problem-solving?

options.text: Take direct action to eliminate the problem quickly.
Evaluate different possible scenarios and plan carefully before acting.

questions.question_text: When a project is challenging, do you:

options.text: Draw motivation from your relationships with people involved and focus on teamwork.
Think creatively about new approaches that might lead to a breakthrough.
